text: <@U0E0NEJ8M|diemex> has joined the channel
<@U0E0Z6GCD|j7512> has joined the channel

I’m having an issue where downloading an image from Google Photos is not reporting the orientation of the image. I have a code that opens the Image Picker (Intent = “ACTION_GET_CONTENT”), I then save the file to storage, then read the file in again and use ExifInterface to query the file for its orientation. No matter if I do it on a landscape or portrait file, the orientation is always 0. Any ideas?
I’m using a Nexus 7 2013 device running 4.4.4 for testing
<@U0DC95VCP>: try doing it manually with any google photo pic
since I just tried on like 3 pics with different orientations and exif data is stripped
<@U0548MM6B>: when you say try doing it manually, what do you mean?
like out of app
just download an image from google photos and check it
<@U0548MM6B>: Okay, I’ll give that a whirl.

<@U0548MM6B>: Yeah that works…it’s odd though, if I download the file from Photos and save it to the device, and then open it with a Photo Editor program, that program opens it with the correct orientation…I wonder how it knows to right the photo, but I can’t get that information (even after I download the file to the device, it still shows an orientation of 0).
when you take a picture otherwise (camera) and load it, it recognizes the orientation?
if no, then it’s your code
I still get an orientation of 0, but my app recognizes the orientation just fine so I don’t even have to worry about it at that point.
The ExifInterface stuff seems pretty straightforward, not sure how I could be messing that up.
but now you got me wondering since I can’t get no exif info out of any google photos image
trying on my mac
that’s my onActivityResult handler…I tried to rule out as many variables as I could so I’m doing everything right there for the purpose of this test
i think it's triple ticks for code blocks ;) ```
heyyyyy nooooww….lol
yeah seems ok
but telling you, it might be just google photos tho
try on your mac
since mine shows no exif info for photos downloaded from there
like not even camera info
I’ve also been playing around with <https://github.com/jdamcd/android-crop> for cropping and have noticed they are having the same problem with images downloaded from photos.
